Professor's Note: The difference between testing for impairment and measuring the
impairment loss can be confusing. In testing for impairment, undiscounted cash
flows are used. Once impairment has been detected, the loss is based on fair value
or the discounted expected future cash flows. Using undiscounted cash flows to test
for impairment keeps PPÉE assets from becoming "impaired” by increases in the
discount rate when interest rates increase.
